intro: Pouteria dominigensis f. cuprea, commonly known as the red-leaf pouteria, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that often display a striking reddish hue. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by edible, sweet fruits resembling small mangoes. Its ornamental value is largely due to its vibrant foliage and unique fruit structure. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
